verbs.description: [ARG1: australia] [V: shifts] [ARGM-CAU: on refusal to send refugees to new zealand] the prime minister has signaled that he could accept new zealand longstanding offer to resettle 150 refugees exiled to pacific islands as long as the australian parliament legislates to ban them from ever setting foot in australia prime minister scott morrison said on wednesday he was willing to brief non - government senators on the travel ban bill there is no support for that bill at present morrison told reporters the center - left opposition labor party argues that a lifetime ban on refugees ever visiting australia on a tourist or business visa was unnecessary and against australia interests refugee action coalition australia canberra australian parliament prime minister scott morrison prime minister papua new guinea united states labor party new zealand america u n ian rintoul malcolm turnbull house of representatives sydney nauru pacific islands
